intro: Oxytropis andersii, commonly known as the Andes oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are often trifoliate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Oxytropis andersii is an important plant in its native ecosystem, contributing to soil stabilization and providing food for local wildlife.
